In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can achieve this in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ") # split string into array of words
    lines = String[] # initialize an empty array for the lines
    current_line = "" # start with an empty line

    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width # check if adding this word would exceed width limit
            push!(lines, current_line) # add current line to result and start a new one
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= " $word" # append the next word to the current line
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line) # don't forget to add the last line after the loop ends
    return join(lines, "\n") # join all lines into a single string with new lines between them and return it
end
```

You can use the function like this:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque ac leo at turpis cursus elementum ut a augue."
print(wrap_string(s))
```

This will output:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit 
amet, consectetur 
adipiscing elit. Pellentesque ac leo at 
turpis cursus elementum ut a augue.
```
